revision.text: Possibly: A geographical description of the four parts of the world, taken from the notes & workes of the famous Monsieur Sanson, geographer to the French King, and other eminent travellers and authors : to which are added the commodities, coyns, weights, and measures of the chief places of traffick in the world, compared with those of England, (or London) as to the trade thereof. Richard Blome; Nicolas Sanson. ( London Printed by T.N. for R. Blome ... and for convenience are also sold by Nath. Brooks ... Edw. Brewster ... and Tho. Basset 1670). http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/838866781
